result.execSummary:
The defendant Julius T Chapman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Armed Robbery with Threat of Force [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Pay all costs, fees and surcharges. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. Provide DNA sample and pay DNA surcharge.
Court costs, fees, and surcharges be paid through collection by the department of Corrections from 25% of funds/earnings.
Defendant to enter into a payment plan with the agent.
with credit for 218 days time served.

superMiscConds.notes: Be enrolled in educational/vocational programming at least 40 hours per week, or maintain verifiable employment of at least 40 hours per week, or a combination of both.

No contact with the victims as listed in the criminal complaint.
No contact with any Family Dollar Store location.
No association with C.H. dob 6/12/99.

AODA assessment and comply with recommended treatment.
Maintain absolute sobriety. Random urine screens.

supervisions.notes:
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess any gun or other firearms. 
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

charges.descr: Armed Robbery with Threat of Force

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Julius T Chapman

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Per Order signed on April 4, 2016:  "to state that the defendant is convicted of Armed Robbery with Threat of Force, Party to a Crime, a Class C felony in violations of sections 943.32(2) and 939.05"
Order Amending Judgment of Conviction received, signed, and filed with court.
Per Order of Presiding Judge, Misdemeanor Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. Jeffrey A. Wagner, Br. 38, calendar successor, for review. mag
DOC request to clarify offense severity.

Exhibits received and inventoried this date.  
Box 673
cf
PSI received and filed. Parties notified. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.

Defendant Julius T Chapman in court with attorney Awni M Yasin.  Defendant Julius T Chapman in custody.  Deann L Heard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for final pretrial. Parties have reached a resolution in this matter. State placed negotiations on the record. Plea hearing proceeded.
Defendant sworn in.

As to COUNT 1-
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum, and Jury Instructions received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty.  Judgment of conviction entered.
  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess any gun or other firearms. 
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  

Court advised defendant if he is not a citizen of the United States of America, that upon a plea of guilty or no contest for this offense, he could be deported, excluded from admission to his country, or denied naturalization under federal law.  
Court advised that the defendant will have to provide a DNA sample, to the Wisconsin State Crime Laboratory for DNA testing and pay a DNA surcharge.

Court ordered a presentence investigation WITHOUT a recommendation.  Order for presentence investigation signed and filed.
Defense counsel is unavailable during the months of October and November. Defendant wishes attorney Yasin to remain counsel of record and agrees to a sentencing date in December. 
Court ordered the defendant REMANDED into custody. 
Court vacated the jury trial date of 9/14/15.
Case adjourned to Branch 25. 
  Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 8, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant enters a SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND.  Case must be tried on or before:  10/08/15.

Attorney Awni M Yasin in court, defendant Julius T Chapman not in court, in custody.  Deann L Heard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel waived his client's appearance and entered a SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND on behalf of his client.  Parties were advised that as of August 1, 2015, this calendar will be transferred to the Hon. Stephanie G. Rothstein, Branch 25, in Room G-55A of the Criminal Justice Facility.   Court set the following motion schedule: any motions to be filed must be filed with the court on or before 7/30/15; response due 8/19/15; reply due by 8/24/15.  All motions in limine, completed substantive jury instructions, jury instructions and witness lists are to be filed one week prior to the final pretrial date.  Final pre-trial scheduled for September 2, 2015 at 01:30 pm.  Motion hearing scheduled for September 9, 2015 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for September 14, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Attorney Awni M Yasin in court, defendant Julius T Chapman not in court, in custody.  Deann L Heard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Matter before the Court for Status conference.  Defendant not produced.  Attorney Yasin appears as successor counsel and needs time to review discovery; date selected.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Victoria Mccandless in court, defendant Julius T Chapman not in court, in custody.  Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel waived her client's appearance and advised the Court that the Public Defender's Office represents the defendant's juvenile co-defendants.  Motion of the defense counsel to withdraw granted by the Court.  Court ordered case continued before Branch 20 for status of counsel.  Status conference scheduled for July 1, 2015 at 08:30 am.
records.descr: Motion and order for withdrawal of counsel

records.addlTxt:
Certification of transcript of proceedings of PRELIMINARY HEARING commencing 05/14/2015 received and filed. (12 Pages.)
Copy of transcript forwarded to Victoria McCandless, 819 N. 6th St., 9th Fl, Milwaukee, WI 53203.

Defendant Julius T Chapman in court with attorney Victoria Mccandless.  Defendant Julius T Chapman in custody.  Kimberly Schoepp for Deann L Heard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Troy Johnson-MPD Detective.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 20.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 17, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Family Dollar Store at 2214 N 35th Street, Milwaukee, WI; Shanisha J.; Elyse C.; Jacqueline D. or Keyon F.

Defendant Julius T Chapman in court with attorney Victoria Mccandless.  Defendant Julius T Chapman in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Moroney, Branch 20.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings. DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  
  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he/she may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he/she meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).
  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 14, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
